revised_title: Sphinx Ligustri Nervous System Development and Comparison to Vertebrates
tldr: The author, George Newport, examines the nervous system of the Sphinx ligustri caterpillar and moth, detailing the changes it undergoes during its development. He compares the insect's nervous system to that of vertebrates, focusing on the ganglia, nerves, and the sympathetic system. Newport also provides drawings to illustrate the paper's findings.
